tool.name: FloodDataDownloader

param.name: in_poly
param.dialogReference: The area of the restoration site being assessed. These areas will be compared to the NHDPlus Version 2.1 VPU to determine which catchments the sites intersect with.

param.name: VUB
param.dialogReference: Vector Processing Unit boundary polygons defining the NHDPlus Vector Processing Units for each region where data is available. If no dataset is specified the tool will by default use the VUB "BoundaryUnit.shp" downloaded to the NHDPlusV21 folder in the same directory as the tool. If no dataset is specified and the default dataset is not in the expected location this tool will fail to run.

param.name: outTable
param.dialogReference:
A file name and location must be specified for the dataset that results from the analysis. In this case that is the NHDPlus Catchment files that are downloaded. For the Full Indicator Assessment tool to perform Flood Risk Reduction Benefit analysis this file must be saved in the default File Geodatabase "NHDPlus_Downloads.gdb" within the NHDPlusV21 folder downloaded to the same directory as the tool. For example ~\Rapid-Benefit-Indicators-Tools\py_Spatial\NHDPlusV21\NHDPlus_Downloads.gdb

If you wish to save Catchment files in an alternative location, the Partial tool Flood Risk Reduction must be used for Flood Risk Reduction Benefit analysis instead of the Full Indicator Assessment tool.

tool.summary: The Flood Data Download tool determined what catchments are needed for delineating upstream and downstream areas for each site and then downloads the catchments for that region.
tool.usage: Download NHDPlus V2.1 catchments for use when calculating Flood Risk Reduction Benefits.

searchKeys.keyword: Flood Risk Reduction Benefits; NHD+; Data Download; RBI; Rapid Benefit Indicators; Ecosystem Services

Consts.useLimit: The United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) RBI project code is provided on an "as is" basis and the user assumes responsibility for its use. Any reference to specific commercial products, processes, or services by service mark, trademark, manufacturer, or otherwise, does not constitute or imply their endorsement, recomendation or favoring by EPA. dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Flood Data Download tool determined what catchments are needed for delineating upstream and downstream areas for each site and then downloads the catchments for that region.
